titleStmt.title: G. H. Chism et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8654

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: His Eccelency the Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner John C Bake makes known to your honor that at the Sept term of the Franklin Circuit Court he was fined by an indictment of the Grand Jury for Retailing Spiritous Liquors contrary to law with no intention of violating the law and have Paid all the Cost there on and ther is $20 yet due to the Commonwealth and prays your honor to remit the Same

We whos names are under Signed State to your Eccelency that we ar well acquainted with your Petitioner John C Baker and Know him to be a peacable Quiet and inefencive citizen and not dispersed to violate the Law in any respect and he is a Pore man and has a wife and a family of helpless Children and is unable to pay the Same with out doing to them serious injury and hope your Simpathies will be extended to the inosent and helpless and that you will remit the Same as the prayer of your petitioners

G. H. Chism
Lloyd Hackett
R E Collins
H B Innes
F Tracy
H M Bedford
Jno, A, Crittenden
W F Parrent
P. Swigert
G O Rickkon M D.
G F hackett
A, J, Duncun
W H,, Gray
Jas, M, Todd
S goins
J, H, Reddish
John pilcher

Franklin Cir Cit
vs
J C Baker

vs
F C Baker
Tipling
$20 --
12th Jany/63
Remitted
